creator: jkean@palantirtech.com
text:
when using <tasdef>, the onerror property is ignored if set to "fail".

The included script should fail when run, but it runs completely and even reports the run as successful.



This is reproducible using Ant 1.7.1

I am afraid that is the defined (if not very useful) behavior. The onerror attribute is used for definitions, (i.e. "taskname"->class using a classpath) but not for resource search (i.e resource="not a good resource"). Believe it or not there are build scripts that depend on this silly behavior.
